issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: eucanetd
components.description: Used to track component level items associated with Edge.

fields.description:
Despite the network JSON parameter being set properly to the CLC address, instances in a VPC are receiving 8.8.8.8 as their name server. Additionally there is no search path in the resolv.conf causing further issues even if it were set.

On an instance resolve.conf looks like this:
{code}
[root@euca-172-31-2-54 ~]# cat /etc/resolv.conf
; generated by /sbin/dhclient-script
nameserver 8.8.8.8
{code} 

The network JSON is set as follows:
{noformat}
[root@b-05 chef]# euca-describe-properties cloud.network.network_configuration
PROPERTY        cloud.network.network_configuration     {
  "Mode": "VPCMIDO",
  "InstanceDnsServers": [
    "10.111.1.5"
  ],
  "PublicIps": [
    "10.116.130.1-10.116.130.254"
  ],
  "Clusters": [
    {
      "Name": "one",
      "Subnet": {
        "Subnet": "172.32.192.0",
        "Netmask": "255.255.255.0",
        "Name": "172.32.192.0",
        "Gateway": "172.32.192.1"
      }
    }
  ]
}
{noformat}

Global XML view is as follows:
{noformat}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<network-data>
  <configuration>
    <property name="publicIps">
      <value>10.116.130.1-10.116.130.254</value>
    </property>
    <property name="enabledCLCIp">

    </property>

    </property>

    </property>
    <property name="clusters">

  </configuration>
  <vpcs>

{noformat}
fields.summary: VPC: Instances always receiving 8.8.8.8 as DNS server, despite network json config

comments.body:
From midokura:
{noformat}
midonet> list bridge
bridge bridge0 name vb_vpc-d50c66e9_subnet-3294f8d3 state up
bridge bridge1 name eucabr state up
bridge bridge2 name vb_vpc-0d2a81d9_subnet-9f3b7ec4 state up
midonet> bridge bridge1 dhcp
Missing arguments, incomplete command
midonet> bridge bridge1 dhcp list
midonet> bridge bridge0 dhcp list
gw 172.31.0.1 server 172.31.0.1 dns-servers 8.8.8.8 subnet 172.31.0.0/20 opt121-routes []
midonet> bridge bridge2 dhcp list
gw 172.31.0.1 server 172.31.0.1 dns-servers 8.8.8.8 subnet 172.31.0.0/20 opt121-routes []
midonet>
{noformat}
This could be related to 8.8.8.8 being set originally and eucanetd not reacting to the configuration change properly. I tried created new VPC and subnets but the 8.8.8.8 value sticks.

commit 54efd5fe7a1e509ce3a191c31531ff7ada43f7f8
Author: Daniel Nurmi <nurmi@eucalyptus.com>
Date:   Fri Nov 7 15:06:59 2014 -0800

    fixes to EUCA-10132 and EUCA-10134 - VPC instances only getting 8.8.8.8 as DNS now get the configured DNS servers - eucanetd failing to boot on non CC host now will boot on standalone CLC
Works as expected. Opened EUCA-10158 to track issue of not being able to change it once it has been set.
